{"step_by_step_thinking": "The primary cutting edge angle refers to the angle formed between the primary cutting edge of a dental instrument and the surface being worked on. According to G.V. Black, the primary cutting edge angle should be less than 50 degrees. This angle is important as it affects the efficiency and effectiveness of the instrument in cutting and removing dental tissues. A smaller angle allows for better control and precision during dental procedures.", "answer_choice": "C. Less than 50 degree"}
